image.altText: A woman in a black jacket and red scarf stands in front of a red wall

items.synopsis: Lawyers for two of mining billionaire Gina Rinehart's children ask the Supreme Court why their mother will not front court to answer key questions in a case over billions of dollars in Pilbara iron ore mines.

title.children: 'She won't come to court': Lawyer asks why Gina Rinehart won't be cross-examined in mining royalties trial

image.altText: Packets of the drug naloxone in nasal spray form.

items.synopsis: A drug which can temporarily reverse opioid overdoses and restore normal breathing to become standard issue for police officers in Western Australia.

title.children: Fentanyl, opioid overdose reversal drug to be carried by WA police officers, in Australian first

image.altText: Composite image of two women and two men, all smiling.

items.synopsis: The woman who cooked a meal that is believed to have contained poisonous mushrooms and led to the deaths of three people gives a lengthy written statement to police detailing her account of what happened, and revealing she was hospitalised after the incident.

title.children: Woman who cooked suspected poisoned meal details where she bought mushrooms

image.altText: A composite image of Marcus Stewart and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price

items.synopsis: A prominent Yes campaigner for an Indigenous Voice to Parliament has accused No campaigner and Shadow Indigenous Australians Minister Jacinta Nampijinpa Price of "hate" for First Nations people after she called welcome to country ceremonies "divisive".

title.children: Yes campaigner takes aim at Jacinta Nampijinpa Price over welcome to country stance

image.altText: West Coast Eagles AFL player Nic Naitanui shouts as he runs after kicking a goal against Fremantle Dockers.

items.synopsis: West Coast Eagles great Nic Naitanui announces his retirement from football, joining fellow veterans Shannon Hurn and Luke Shuey in hanging up the boots.

title.children: West Coast Eagles 'legacy player' Nic Naitanui announces retirement from footy

image.altText: A large metal security gate and a high fence lined with barbed wire, stretching several metres.

items.synopsis: A report by the Inspectorate of Custodial Services has highlighted dilapidated conditions at the Kimberley facility with few improvements carried out for more than a decade.

title.children: 'Really, really dire' Broome prison needs urgent intervention, union claims

image.altText: A youth walks down a street in Roebourne alongside a metal fence.

items.synopsis: Once synonymous with alcohol abuse and social malaise, Roebourne is a town in recovery. But traditional owners lament what they say are the divisions caused by a mining giant.

title.children: 'Triumph and tragedy' of town divided in fight against mining giant

image.altText: Lockie

items.synopsis: Thousands of babies who've been exposed to their mother's drug use are born in Australia every year. Help is difficult to find.

title.children: Terrianne has used ice throughout pregnancies. This time was different

image.altText: Mark Latham speaks with Pauline Hanson in the background.

items.synopsis: One Nation MP Mark Latham says he was removed from the party "without consultation or due process".

title.children: Mark Latham dumped by Pauline Hanson as One Nation's NSW leader

image.altText: Headshot of Epidemiologist Mary-Louise McLaws.

items.synopsis: The scientific community pays tribute to the calm, warm epidemiologist who led Australia during the COVID-19 pandemic who some say was more respected than a head of state.

title.children: 'Authoritative but thoughtful': Leading scientists pay tribute to pandemic epidemiologist Mary-Louise McLaws

image.altText: Australian goalie Mackenzie Arnold celebrates during penalty shootout against France in Women's World Cup

items.synopsis: She had the chance to win it all, but then Mackenzie Arnold hit the post. How she came back to win the World Cup shootout said everything about the Matildas' journey here.

title.children: How Mackenzie Arnold's shootout performance personified the Matildas' longer journey

image.altText: A close-up shot of a pallet of cardboard boxes being pulled by a red and black pallet jack.

items.synopsis: WA authorities discover 300,000 vapes in a Perth warehouse, along with more than 10 tonnes of illegal prescription drugs and "nangs",  in what they say is the biggest-ever bust of its kind in Australia.

title.children: More than 25 tonnes of vapes and 'nangs' found hidden in record seizure

image.altText: Side by side photos of business logos for accounting firms Deloitte, PwC, KPMG and EY

items.synopsis: The infiltration of EY, Deloitte, KPMG and PwC in government departments has been well documented. What is less well known is their role in the private sector, where experts fear a sleeper issue could trigger a corporate collapse, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: How a sleeper issue inside the big four accounting giants could topple the economy

image.altText: A man in a yellow puffer jacket, walking with his hands in his pockets and his head down.

items.synopsis: Westfield Belconnen store employee Abhishek Timalsina allegedly closed the security shutters of his workplace, encouraged a woman inside to enter a staffroom and raped her in November 2022.

title.children: Case of worker who allegedly raped customer in shopping centre begins to wrap up

image.altText: man with weights in gym

items.synopsis: An increasing demand for steroids in young men has been linked to a growing uptake for a needle and syringe exchange program, leading to calls for more education on the side effects.

title.children: 'You're just relying on the next gym bro': Young men desperate for safe steroid advice

image.altText: young boy in blue button up shirt with mullet pouts

items.synopsis: Caleb Puttyfoot, 16, is being remembered as a "truly great person" and a proud older brother after he succumbed to injuries sustained when he was allegedly struck by a four-wheel drive.

title.children: Tributes for teen who 'fought so hard' after alleged hit and run

image.altText: Close up photo of an older white male with blue eyes

items.synopsis: The President of the NSW RSL is formally apologising to Vietnam War veterans after many were initially "refused entry" due to the belief they didn't fight in "a real war".

title.children: RSL NSW apologises for 50-year snub of Vietnam War veterans

image.altText: A US one dollar bill sits with Australian currency

items.synopsis: Australian dollar ‘at risk of a slide’ as China’s economic troubles deepen.

title.children: Aussie dollar tumbles as anxiety grows over China’s economy

image.altText: a skyline with houses

items.synopsis: Full-time early childhood educators, nurses and aged care workers are among those who cannot afford a large swathe of Australia's rental properties.

title.children: 'One in a 100': Essential workers priced out in Australia's rental crisis

image.altText: People pray in church on their knees

items.synopsis: A crowd-sourced online database has been launched to find missing individuals as friends and family mourn those killed in the devastating Hawaiian wildfires.

title.children: 'God took a really good man': Friends heartbroken over those dead in Maui blaze

image.altText: A skiier in a yellow jacket skis down a steep slope

items.synopsis: Discretionary spending is money you don't need to spend to keep yourself fed, housed and clothed. What's happening at alpine resorts — remote and relatively expensive — tells us about an important shift in the Australian economy.

title.children: Australians are reducing their spending as the cost of living soars. But that doesn't mean they're making rational choices

image.altText: A composite image of Sam Kerr and Michele Bullock

items.synopsis: From the Matildas to some of the most important appointments in the country, Australian women are beginning to receive the acknowledgement and opportunities at the top of their fields that unquestionably until now have been denied, writes John Lyons.

title.children: What Sam Kerr and new RBA governor Michele Bullock have in common

image.altText: The tail of a Jetstar aircraft showing its name an livery

items.synopsis: The airline confirms it has cancelled flights between Darwin and Denpasar for three weeks in October due to runway upgrades at Darwin Airport.

title.children: 'Disappointing and frustrating': Jetstar cancels October flights between Darwin and Bali

image.altText: Police detectives in bushland searching the ground.

items.synopsis: Police have charged a teenager with murder after a 16-year-old-boy was fatally stabbed north of Coffs Harbour in New South Wales on Sunday night.

title.children: Community in shock as police charge teenager with murder over alleged Coffs Harbour stabbing

image.altText: A composite image of a woman wearing a t-shirt that says "love" before and after breast reduction surgery.

items.synopsis: Surgery to decrease bra cup sizes is on the increase in Australia. Helen Stojanovski just wishes she'd booked her surgery sooner.

title.children: The number of Aussies getting breast reductions has tripled in three years. Helen is one of them

image.altText: Side by side images of a resort town. Left it is green and has boats in the water, on the right brown and burned down, no boats.

items.synopsis: Aerial footage and satellite images show how devastating the fires that engulfed the Hawaiian island of Maui have been, as crews continue searching for survivors.

title.children: Lahaina was once a lush green resort town, it's now been reduced to ash and rubble

image.altText: A tree painted with words build the road in silver paint.

items.synopsis: The latest protest in a long-running dispute over the protection of culturally significant trees in western Victoria initially earmarked for demolition to make way for a highway upgrade have ramped up after the vandalism of a birthing tree.

title.children: 'Like a death in the family': Sacred Aboriginal birthing tree vandalised as highway upgrade dispute ramps up

image.altText: A generic photo of a green seedling in dirt in an egg carton, with other little seedlings around it.

items.synopsis: We heard from more than 1,000 of you who shared the little, and big, things you do to reduce your waste footprint. There were plenty of new and novel ideas for reusing and recycling, so we're tapping into the brains trust.

title.children: We asked for your waste-busting tips. Here are some of your suggestions

image.altText: A man holds two green apples in his hands

items.synopsis: While inflation on food has gone down according to stats from the Australian Bureau of Statistics June 2023 report, prices for things like dairy and bread remain sky high.

title.children: Food prices have risen 7.5 per cent in the last year. Here's what that looks like at the check-out

image.altText: Copy of Thumbnail

items.synopsis: China's president Xi has not visited the places devastated by the two weeks of torrential rain and flooding, which has angered and confused many people.

title.children: While floods ravage northern China, people are wondering — where is President Xi Jinping?

image.altText: A meteor with a long white tail in the night sky.

items.synopsis: The annual Perseid meteor shower reached its peak this weekend, sending bright trails of light streaking across the night sky around the world.

title.children: Spectacular meteor shower lights up skies across the world
